intro: Sisymbrium thalianum var. pusillum, commonly known as the dwarf wall rocket, is a small annual plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many economically important crops and weeds. The plant typically grows to a height of less than 10 cm, with small, elongated leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found along roadsides and in dry, rocky habitats. Its seeds are small and can remain viable in the soil for several years, contributing to its persistence in various environments.
